alert.note: Alert for East Sweetwater County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:59PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Sweetwater County through 430 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southeast of Bitter Creek Rest Area, which is also 19 miles southwest of Wamsutter, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include...Wamsutter. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 161 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
